Description: Flat circular basketry dish of woven palm leaf, with two loaves of unleavened bread. One piece of bread has hand imprints on both sides of the loaf, probably left by the baker.
Curator's comments: Published: G. Hart, Egyewitness Guides: Ancient Egypt, 1990, p.48.
For a range of such platters from Deir el-Medina, see Gourlay, Les sparteries de Deir el-Medineh (DFIFAO 17, 1981), esp. pls.8-9.
J.H. Taylor & D. Antoine, Ancient Lives New Discoveries, London 2014, p. 41
Bibliographic references: Cartwright and Taylor 2015 / Ancient Egyptian funerary food: new insights (p.98, table.1, p.100, fig.1, p.102, fig.8, p.105)
